channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Surprise Market Winner of 2024: The Great British Pound
item.description: The pound was mocked as the “Great British Peso” not long ago. Suddenly, it is the best-performing currency in developed markets.

item.title: Boeing reportedly considers issuing $10 billion in new shares as strike lingers
item.description: Boeing Co.’s stock fell 2.6% early Tuesday, after a Bloomberg report that the aerospace giant is considering raising at least $10 billion by issuing n...

item.title: That 5% CD Is a Great Deal---Until the Bank Calls It Back
item.description: With the Fed cutting interest rates, some savers are learning that there is fine print on their certificates of deposit.

item.title: Stock buyback programs surge in popularity in 2024, despite 1% tax
item.description: Buybacks are popular in a hot stock market and despite concerns about a potential increase to the 1% buyback tax

item.title: Intel’s troubles set back America’s drive for semiconductor independence
item.description: Biden administration’s Chips and Science Act hits a rough patch.

item.title: U.S. Stock Futures Flat as Quarter Begins
item.description: U.S. stock futures wavered. Growth was in focus as a new quarter got under way, with data on manufacturing and the U.S. jobs market due.

item.title: Euro Stays Weaker Against Dollar After Eurozone Inflation Data
item.description: The euro remained weaker against the dollar after data showed eurozone inflation eased in September as expected.

item.title: Base-Metal Demand From Energy Transition to Offset Some China Real-Estate Losses, SMM Says
item.description: Base-metals demand in China will be largely driven by electric vehicles, renewable power, lithium-ion batteries and related infrastructure investment ...

item.title: Bud Light sales will be ‘permanently’ lower. Citi says buy Anheuser-Busch InBev anyway
item.description: Bud Light sales are never going to recover. And yet now is the time to buy shares of its brewer, Anheuser-Busch InBev, say analysts at Citi.

item.title: Nio’s stock keeps surging after EV maker reports new quarterly deliveries record
item.description: Stocks of Nio and other China-based EV makers extended their recent sharp gains Tuesday, after they reported record deliveries data.
